original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields down after rate cut, rupee steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bonds were quoted sharply lower Thursday dealers said, after the central bank cut is main policy rate which is serving a signalling function 250 basis points.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 24.00/50 percent down from 26.60/26.90 percent a day earlier dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 25.00/26.50 percent down 27.75/28.50 percent a day earlier.
The central bank cut is policy rate at which overnight money is injected to 14.0 percent to from 16.5 percent Thursday. There is a gap between the injection rate and market rates.
Sri Lanka cuts policy rates 250 basis points amid BOP surplus
Sri Lanka exports down in April, trade deficit up from March, rupee stronger
Sri Lanka has not issued bonds recently and has mostly sold Treasury bills, ahead of a debt restructuring strategy being announced.
the Spot US dollar opened at 290/291 to the US dollar, dealers said. The rupee closed at 290.25/75 to the US dollar Wednesday.
The rupee has appreciated amid generally deflationary liquidity operations by the central bank in recent months and slow domestic credit.
The central bank said it was cutting rates, with inflation falling and balance of payments pressures easing. (Colombo/June01/2023)
